para.p:
The Mellin transform of
: f
→
( 0 , ∞ )
C
is defined by

Math.text: M * f * s = ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(x ^ (s - 1) * f * x * differential-d@(x))

para.p:
For example,
↦ s
⁢ Γ
( s )
is the Mellin transform of
↦ x
e
- x
.

f
continuous on

0

. Then [, p. 107, Proposition 9.7.7]

α

para.p: Cohen [, pp. 177–182, §10.2.5] presents a “generalized Poisson summation formula” which yields both the Poisson summation formula and the Voronoi summation formula.

We denote by
⁢ S
( R )
the Fréchet space of Schwartz functions
→ R C
.

Let
a
be arithmetic function and define

Math.text: formulae@(L * open-interval@(a, s) = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * n ^ (- s)), real-part@(s) > 1)

para.p:
Suppose that
⁢ L
( a , s )
has an analytic continuation to
C
whose only possible pole is at
= s 1
. Suppose also that there are
>
A ,
a 1
, … ,
a g
0
such that for

Math.text: gamma * s = A ^ s * ((product _ (j = 1)) ^ g)@(Gamma * a _ j * s)

para.p:
⁢ L
( a , s )
satisfies the functional equation

Math.text: gamma * s * L * open-interval@(a, s) = gamma * (1 - s) * L * open-interval@(a, 1 - s)

para.p:
Let
∈ f
⁢ S
( R )
and define for
> x 0
,

Math.text: formulae@(K * x = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(((gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s))) * x ^ (- s) * differential-d@(s)), g * x = ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * y * K * x * y * differential-d@(y)))
((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * f * n) = f * 0 * L * open-interval@(a, 0) + Res _ (s = 1) * M * f * s * L * open-interval@(a, s) + ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * g * n)

para.p:
Since
f
is a Schwartz function,
⁢ M
( f )
is holomorphic on
>
ℜ
( s )
0
. Futhermore, for
>
ℜ
( s )
0
, integrating by parts,

Math.text: M * f * s = ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(x ^ (s - 1) * f * x * differential-d@(x)) = evaluated-at@(f * x * (x ^ s / s), 0, infinity) - ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f ^ prime * x * (x ^ s / s) * differential-d@(x)) = - (1 / s) * M * f ^ prime * (s + 1)

para.p:
It follows that
⁢ M
( f )
has an analytic continuation to
C
possibly with poles at
0 ,
- 1
,
- 2
,
- 3
, …
. Write
= F
⁢ M
( f )
. By the Mellin inversion formula we get

Math.text: ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * f * n) = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(n ^ (- s) * F * s * differential-d@(s)))
((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * f * n)
absent = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(n ^ (- s) * F * s * differential-d@(s)))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(F * s * ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a _ n * n ^ (- s) * d * s))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(F * s * ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a _ n * n ^ (- s) * d * s))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(F * s * L * open-interval@(a, s) * differential-d@(s))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(F * s * L * open-interval@(a, s) * differential-d@(s))

para.p:
The only possible pole of
⁢ L
( a , s )
is at
= s 1
. From

Math.text: M * f * s = - (1 / s) * M * f ^ prime * (s + 1)

para.p:
the only possible pole of
⁢ F
( s )
in the half-plane
>
ℜ
( s )
- 1
is at
= s 0
, and the residue of
⁢ F
( s )
L
( a , s )
at
= s 0
is

Math.text: - M * f ^ prime * 1 = - ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f ^ prime * x * differential-d@(x)) = - f * infinity - f * 0 = f * 0

para.p:
so the residue of
⁢ F
( s )
L
( a , s )
at
= s 0
is

Math.text: f * 0 * L * open-interval@(a, 0)

→

0

,

G * s = F * (1 - s) * ((gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s)))

para.p:
Using the functional equation for
⁢ L
( a , s )
,

Math.text: (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = - 1 / 2))@(F * s * L * open-interval@(a, s) * differential-d@(s)) = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = - 1 / 2))@(F * s * ((gamma * (1 - s)) / (gamma * s)) * L * open-interval@(a, 1 - s) * differential-d@(s))

absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(F * (1 - s) * ((gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s))) * L * open-interval@(a, s) * differential-d@(s))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(G * s * L * open-interval@(a, s) * differential-d@(s))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(G * s * L * open-interval@(a, s) * differential-d@(s))
J * x = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@((1 / (1 - s)) * ((gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s))) * x ^ (1 - s) * differential-d@(s))
J ^ prime * x = K * x

(1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(x ^ (- s) * G * s * differential-d@(s)) = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(x ^ (- s) * F * (1 - s) * ((gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s))) * differential-d@(s))
(1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(x ^ (- s) * G * s * differential-d@(s))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(x ^ (- s) * F * (1 - s) * ((gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s))) * differential-d@(s))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(x ^ (- s) * (- (1 / (1 - s)) * M * f ^ prime * (2 - s)) * ((gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s))) * differential-d@(s))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(x ^ (- s) * (- (1 / (1 - s)) * M * f ^ prime * (2 - s)) * ((gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s))) * differential-d@(s))

absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(x ^ (- s) * (- (1 / (1 - s)) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(y ^ (1 - s) * f ^ prime * y * differential-d@(y))) * ((gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s))) * differential-d@(s))

absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(x ^ (- s) * (- (1 / (1 - s)) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(y ^ (1 - s) * f ^ prime * y * differential-d@(y))) * ((gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s))) * differential-d@(s))

absent = - (1 / x) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f ^ prime * y * (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@((1 / (1 - s)) * ((gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s))) * (x * y) ^ (1 - s) * differential-d@(s)))

absent = - (1 / x) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f ^ prime * y * (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@((1 / (1 - s)) * ((gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s))) * (x * y) ^ (1 - s) * differential-d@(s)))
absent = - (1 / x) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f ^ prime * y * J * x * y * differential-d@(y))
absent = - (1 / x) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f ^ prime * y * J * x * y * differential-d@(y))
absent = (- evaluated-at@((1 / x) * f * y * J * x * y, 0, infinity)) + (1 / x) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * y * J ^ prime * x * y * x * differential-d@(y))
absent = (- evaluated-at@((1 / x) * f * y * J * x * y, 0, infinity)) + (1 / x) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * y * J ^ prime * x * y * x * differential-d@(y))
absent = 0 + ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * y * J ^ prime * x * y * differential-d@(y))
absent = 0 + ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * y * J ^ prime * x * y * differential-d@(y))
absent = ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * y * K * x * y * differential-d@(y))
absent = ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * y * K * x * y * differential-d@(y))
absent = g * x
absent = g * x
((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * g * n) = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(n ^ (- s) * G * s * differential-d@(s)))
((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * g * n)
absent = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(n ^ (- s) * G * s * differential-d@(s)))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(G * s * ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * n ^ (- s) * d * s))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(G * s * ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * n ^ (- s) * d * s))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(G * s * L * open-interval@(a, s) * differential-d@(s))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(G * s * L * open-interval@(a, s) * differential-d@(s))
((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * f * n) = f * 0 * L * open-interval@(a, 0) + Res _ (s = 1) * F * s * L * open-interval@(a, s) + ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a * n * g * n)

para.p:
Take
=
⁢ a
( n )
1
for all
n
. Then,

Math.text: L * open-interval@(a, s) = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(n ^ (- s)) = zeta * s

para.p: The Riemann zeta function satisfies the functional equation

Math.text: pi ^ (- s / 2) * Gamma * (s / 2) * zeta * s = pi ^ (- (1 - s) / 2) * Gamma * ((1 - s) / 2) * zeta * (1 - s)
gamma * s = pi ^ (- s / 2) * Gamma * (s / 2)
gamma * s * zeta * s = gamma * (1 - s) * zeta * (1 - s)
Gamma * (1 - z) * Gamma * z = pi / sine@(pi * z)
Gamma * z * Gamma * (z + 1 / 2) = 2 ^ (1 - 2 * z) * square-root@(pi) * Gamma * 2 * z
Gamma * ((1 - s) / 2)
absent = Gamma * (1 - (s + 1) / 2)
absent = pi / (sine@(((pi * (s + 1)) / 2) * Gamma) * ((s + 1) / 2))
absent = pi / (sine@(((pi * (s + 1)) / 2) * Gamma) * ((s + 1) / 2))
absent = pi / (sine@(((pi * (s + 1)) / 2) * Gamma) * (s / 2 + 1 / 2))
absent = pi / (sine@(((pi * (s + 1)) / 2) * Gamma) * (s / 2 + 1 / 2))
absent = (pi * Gamma * (s / 2)) / (sine@(((pi * (s + 1)) / 2) * 2 ^ (1 - s) * square-root@(pi) * Gamma) * s)
absent = (pi * Gamma * (s / 2)) / (sine@(((pi * (s + 1)) / 2) * 2 ^ (1 - s) * square-root@(pi) * Gamma) * s)

(pi ^ (- s / 2) * Gamma * (s / 2)) / (pi ^ (- (1 - s) / 2) * Gamma * ((1 - s) / 2)) = (pi ^ ((- s) + 1 / 2) * Gamma * (s / 2)) cdot ((sine@(((pi * (s + 1)) / 2) * 2 ^ (1 - s) * square-root@(pi) * Gamma) * s) / (pi * Gamma * (s / 2)))
absent = (pi ^ ((- s) + 1 / 2) * Gamma * (s / 2)) cdot ((sine@(((pi * (s + 1)) / 2) * 2 ^ (1 - s) * square-root@(pi) * Gamma) * s) / (pi * Gamma * (s / 2)))
absent = sine@(((pi * (s + 1)) / 2) cdot 2) * (2 * pi) ^ (- s) * Gamma * s
absent = sine@(((pi * (s + 1)) / 2) cdot 2) * (2 * pi) ^ (- s) * Gamma * s
absent = cosine@(((pi * s) / 2) cdot 2) * (2 * pi) ^ (- s) * Gamma * s
absent = cosine@(((pi * s) / 2) cdot 2) * (2 * pi) ^ (- s) * Gamma * s

K * x = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(((gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s))) * x ^ (- s) * differential-d@(s)) = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ (real-part@(s) = 3 / 2))@(cosine@(((pi * s) / 2) cdot 2) * (2 * pi) ^ (- s) * Gamma * s * x ^ (- s) * differential-d@(s))
((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(cosine@(2 * pi * x) * x ^ (s - 1) * differential-d@(x)) = (2 * pi) ^ (- s) * cosine@(((pi * s) / 2) * Gamma) * s
K * x = 2 * cosine@(2 * pi * x)

para.p:
Thus Theorem tells us that for
∈ f
⁢ S
( R )
,

Math.text: ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(f * n) = f * 0 * zeta * 0 + Res _ (s = 1) * M * f * s * zeta * s + 2 * ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * y * cosine@(2 * pi * n * y) * differential-d@(y)))

((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(f * n) = (- (1 / 2) * f * 0) + ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * x * differential-d@(x)) + 2 * ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * y * cosine@(2 * pi * n * y) * differential-d@(y)))

para.p:
If
: f
→ R C
is even, this is the Poisson summation formula.

gamma * s = pi ^ (- s) * Gamma * (s / 2) ^ 2

para.p:
it follows from the functional equation for the Riemann zeta function that
⁢ L
( d , s )
satisfies the functional equation

Math.text: gamma * s * L * open-interval@(d, s) = gamma * (1 - s) * L * open-interval@(d, 1 - s)
(pi ^ (- s / 2) * Gamma * (s / 2)) / (pi ^ (- (1 - s) / 2) * Gamma * ((1 - s) / 2)) = cosine@(((pi * s) / 2) cdot 2) * (2 * pi) ^ (- s) * Gamma * s
(gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s)) = (2 * pi) ^ (- 2 * s) * 4 * (cosine ^ 2)@(((pi * s) / 2) * Gamma) * s ^ 2
(gamma * s) / (gamma * (1 - s))
absent = (2 * pi) ^ (- 2 * s) * 4 * (cosine ^ 2)@(((pi * s) / 2) * Gamma) * s ^ 2
absent = (2 * pi) ^ (- 2 * s) * (2 + 2 * cosine@(pi * s)) * Gamma * s ^ 2
absent = (2 * pi) ^ (- 2 * s) * (2 + 2 * cosine@(pi * s)) * Gamma * s ^ 2

para.p: Taking as given two identities for Bessel functions

Math.text: ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(x ^ (s - 1) * K _ 0 * 4 * pi * x ^ (1 / 2) * differential-d@(x)) = (1 / 2) * (2 * pi) ^ (- 2 * s) * Gamma * s ^ 2
((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(x ^ (s - 1) * Y _ 0 * 4 * pi * x ^ (1 / 2) * differential-d@(x)) = - (1 / pi) * (2 * pi) ^ (- 2 * s) * cosine@(pi * s * Gamma) * s ^ 2

para.p:
Thus Theorem tells us that for
∈ f
⁢ S
( R )
,

Math.text: ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * f * n) = f * 0 * zeta ^ 2 * 0 + Res _ (s = 1) * M * f * s * zeta ^ 2 * s
((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * f * n)
absent = f * 0 * zeta ^ 2 * 0 + Res _ (s = 1) * M * f * s * zeta ^ 2 * s
+ ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * y * (4 * K _ 0 * 4 * pi * (n * y) ^ (1 / 2) - 2 * pi * Y _ 0 * 4 * pi * (n * y) ^ (1 / 2)) * differential-d@(y)))
+ ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * y * (4 * K _ 0 * 4 * pi * (n * y) ^ (1 / 2) - 2 * pi * Y _ 0 * 4 * pi * (n * y) ^ (1 / 2)) * differential-d@(y)))
formulae@(zeta ^ 2 * s = 1 / (s - 1) ^ 2 + (2 * gamma) / (s - 1) + O * 1, s to 1)
x ^ (s - 1) = 1 + (s - 1) * logarithm@(x) + O * (absolute-value@(s - 1)) ^ 2
Res _ (s = 1) * M * f * s * zeta ^ 2 * s = 2 * gamma + logarithm@(x)
((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * f * n) = (1 / 4) * f * 0 + ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * x * (2 * gamma + logarithm@(x)) * differential-d@(x))
((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * f * n)
absent = (1 / 4) * f * 0 + ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * x * (2 * gamma + logarithm@(x)) * differential-d@(x))
+ ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * y * (4 * K _ 0 * 4 * pi * (n * y) ^ (1 / 2) - 2 * pi * Y _ 0 * 4 * pi * (n * y) ^ (1 / 2)) * differential-d@(y)))
+ ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(f * y * (4 * K _ 0 * 4 * pi * (n * y) ^ (1 / 2) - 2 * pi * Y _ 0 * 4 * pi * (n * y) ^ (1 / 2)) * differential-d@(y)))

para.p: The Bernoulli polynomials are defined by

Math.text: (t * e ^ (t * x)) / (e ^ t - 1) = ((sum _ (m = 0)) ^ infinity)@(B _ m * x * (t ^ m / mfactorial))

para.p:
The Bernoulli numbers are defined by
=
B m
⁢
B m
( 0 )
.

We denote by
[ x ]
the greatest integer
≤
x
, and we define
=
{ x }
- x
[ x ]
, namely, the fractional part of
x
. We define
=
⁢
P m
( x )
⁢
B m
(
{ x }
)
, the Bernoulli functions.
The following result is proved by Wigert []. Our proof follows Titchmarsh [, p. 163, Theorem 7.15]. Cf. Landau [].

Math.text: ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * e ^ (- n * z)) = (((gamma / z - logarithm@(z) / z) + 1 / 4) - ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ (N - 1))@(((B _ (2 * n + 2)) ^ 2 / ((2 * n + 2)factorial * (2 * n + 2))) * z ^ (2 * n + 1))) + O * (absolute-value@(z)) ^ (2 * N)

as
→ z 0
in any angle
≤
|

|
λ
.

For
> σ 1
,

⁢ i t
,

para.p:
Using this, for
>
ℜ z
0
we have

Math.text: (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * ((integral _ (2 - i * infinity)) ^ (2 + i * infinity))@(Gamma * s * zeta ^ 2 * s * z ^ (- s) * differential-d@(s)) = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * ((integral _ (2 - i * infinity)) ^ (2 + i * infinity))@(Gamma * s * (n * z) ^ (- s) * differential-d@(s)))
(1 / (2 * pi * i)) * ((integral _ (2 - i * infinity)) ^ (2 + i * infinity))@(Gamma * s * zeta ^ 2 * s * z ^ (- s) * differential-d@(s))
absent = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * ((integral _ (2 - i * infinity)) ^ (2 + i * infinity))@(Gamma * s * (n * z) ^ (- s) * differential-d@(s)))
absent = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * e ^ (- n * z))
absent = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * e ^ (- n * z))

Define

.
F
has poles at
1 , 0
, and the negative odd integers. (At each negative even integer,
Γ
has a first order pole but
ζ 2
has a second order zero.) First we determine the residue of
F
at
1
. We use the asymptotic formula

Math.text: formulae@(zeta * s = 1 / (s - 1) + gamma + O * absolute-value@(s - 1), s to 1)
formulae@(Gamma * s = (1 - gamma * (s - 1)) + O * (absolute-value@(s - 1)) ^ 2, s to 1)
formulae@(z ^ (- s) = (1 / z - (logarithm@(z) / z) * (s - 1)) + O * (absolute-value@(s - 1)) ^ 2, s to 1)
Gamma * s * zeta ^ s * s * z ^ (- s) = ((1 - gamma * (s - 1)) + O * (absolute-value@(s - 1)) ^ 2) cdot (1 / (s - 1) ^ 2 + (2 * gamma) / (s - 1) + O * (absolute-value@(s - 1)) ^ 2)
Gamma * s * zeta ^ s * s * z ^ (- s)
absent = ((1 - gamma * (s - 1)) + O * (absolute-value@(s - 1)) ^ 2) cdot (1 / (s - 1) ^ 2 + (2 * gamma) / (s - 1) + O * (absolute-value@(s - 1)) ^ 2)
absent cdot ((1 / z - (logarithm@(z) / z) * (s - 1)) + O * (absolute-value@(s - 1)) ^ 2)
absent cdot ((1 / z - (logarithm@(z) / z) * (s - 1)) + O * (absolute-value@(s - 1)) ^ 2)
absent = ((1 / (z * (s - 1) ^ 2) + gamma / (z * (s - 1))) - logarithm@(z) / (z * (s - 1))) + O * 1
absent = ((1 / (z * (s - 1) ^ 2) + gamma / (z * (s - 1))) - logarithm@(z) / (z * (s - 1))) + O * 1

para.p:
Hence the residue of
F
at
1
is

Math.text: gamma / z - logarithm@(z) / z

para.p:
Now we determine the residue of
F
at
0
. The residue of
Γ
at
0
is
1
, and hence the residue of
F
at
0
is

Finally, for
≥ n 0
we determine the residue of
F
at
-
(
+
⁢ 2 n
1
)
. The residue of
Γ
at
-
(
+
⁢ 2 n
1
)
is
(
- 1
)
+
⁢ 2 n
1
!
(
+
⁢ 2 n
1
)
, hence the residue of
F
at
-
(
+
⁢ 2 n
1
)
is

Math.text: formulae@(zeta * (- m) = - B _ (m + 1) / (m + 1), m >= 1)

para.p:
Let
> M 0
, and let
C
be the rectangular path starting at
- 2
⁢ i M
, then going to
+ 2
⁢ i M
, then going to
+
-
⁢ 2 N
⁢ i M
, then going to
-
-
⁢ 2 N
⁢ i M
, and then ending at
- 2
⁢ i M
. By the residue theorem,

Math.text: (integral _ C)@(F * s * differential-d@(s)) = 2 * pi * i * (((gamma / z - logarithm@(z) / z) + 1 / 4 + (sum _ (n = 0)) ^ (N - 1)) - ((B _ (2 * n + 2)) ^ 2 / ((2 * n + 2)factorial * (2 * n + 2))) * z ^ (2 * n + 1))

para.p:
Denote the right-hand sideof () by
⁢ 2 π i R
. We have

Math.text: (integral _ C)@(F * s * differential-d@(s)) = ((integral _ (2 - i * M)) ^ (2 + i * M))@(F * s * differential-d@(s)) + ((integral _ (2 + i * M)) ^ ((- 2 * N) + i * M))@(F * s * differential-d@(s)) + ((integral _ ((- 2 * N) + i * M)) ^ (- 2 * N - i * M))@(F * s * differential-d@(s)) + ((integral _ (- 2 * N - i * M)) ^ (2 - i * M))@(F * s * differential-d@(s))

para.p:
We shall show that the second and fourth integrals tend to
0
as
→ M ∞
. For
= s
+ σ
⁢ i t
with
-
⁢ 2 N
≤ σ ≤ 2
, Stirling’s formula [, p. 151] tells us that

Math.text: formulae@(absolute-value@(Gamma * s) similar-to square-root@(2 * pi) * e ^ (- (pi / 2) * absolute-value@(t)) * (absolute-value@(t)) ^ (sigma - 1 / 2), absolute-value@(t) to infinity)

para.p:
As well [, p. 95], there is some
> K 0
such that in the half-plane
≥ σ
-
⁢ 2 N
,

Math.text: zeta * s = O * (absolute-value@(t)) ^ K
z ^ (- s) = e ^ (- s * logarithm@(z))
absent = e ^ (- s * logarithm@(z))
absent = e ^ (- (sigma + i * t) * (logarithm@(absolute-value@(z)) + i * argument@(z)))
absent = e ^ (- (sigma + i * t) * (logarithm@(absolute-value@(z)) + i * argument@(z)))
absent = e ^ (((- sigma * logarithm@(absolute-value@(z))) + t * argument@(z)) - i * (sigma * argument@(z) + t * logarithm@(absolute-value@(z))))
absent = e ^ (((- sigma * logarithm@(absolute-value@(z))) + t * argument@(z)) - i * (sigma * argument@(z) + t * logarithm@(absolute-value@(z))))

para.p:
and so for
≤
|
arg z
|
λ
,

Math.text: absolute-value@(z ^ (- s)) = e ^ ((- sigma * logarithm@(absolute-value@(z))) + t * argument@(z)) less= e ^ ((- sigma * logarithm@(absolute-value@(z))) + lambda * absolute-value@(t)) = (absolute-value@(z)) ^ (- sigma) * e ^ (lambda * absolute-value@(t))

absolute-value@(((integral _ (2 + i * M)) ^ ((- 2 * N) + i * M))@(F * s * differential-d@(s))) less= (2 + 2 * N) * (supremum _ (- 2 * N less= sigma less= 2))@(absolute-value@(F * (sigma + i * M))) = O * e ^ (- (pi / 2) * M) * M ^ (sigma - 1 / 2) * M ^ (2 * K) * (absolute-value@(z)) ^ (- sigma) * e ^ (lambda * M)

para.p:
and because
< λ
π 2
this tends to
0
as
→ M ∞
. Likewise,

Math.text: absolute-value@(((integral _ (- 2 * N - i * M)) ^ (2 - i * M))@(F * s * differential-d@(s))) to 0

((integral _ (2 - i * infinity)) ^ (2 + i * infinity))@(F * s * differential-d@(s)) + ((integral _ ((- 2 * N) + i * infinity)) ^ (- 2 * N - i * infinity))@(F * s * differential-d@(s)) = 2 * pi * i * R

((integral _ (2 - i * infinity)) ^ (2 + i * infinity))@(F * s * differential-d@(s)) = 2 * pi * i * R + ((integral _ (- 2 * N - i * infinity)) ^ ((- 2 * N) + i * infinity))@(F * s * differential-d@(s))

para.p: We bound the integral on the right-hand side. We have

Math.text: ((integral _ (- 2 * N - i * infinity)) ^ ((- 2 * N) + i * infinity))@(F * s * differential-d@(s)) = (integral _ (formulae@(sigma = - 2 * N, absolute-value@(t) less= 1)))@(F * s * differential-d@(s)) + (integral _ (formulae@(sigma = - 2 * N, absolute-value@(t) > 1)))@(F * s * differential-d@(s))

absolute-value@((integral _ (formulae@(sigma = - 2 * N, absolute-value@(t) less= 1)))@(F * s * differential-d@(s))) less= (integral _ (formulae@(sigma = - 2 * N, absolute-value@(t) less= 1)))@(absolute-value@(Gamma * s * zeta ^ 2 * s) * (absolute-value@(z)) ^ (- sigma) * e ^ (lambda * absolute-value@(t)) * differential-d@(s)) = ((absolute-value@(z)) ^ (2 * N) cdot O) * 1 = O * (absolute-value@(z)) ^ (2 * N)

para.p:
because
⁢ Γ
( s )
ζ 2
( s )
is continuous on the path of integration. The second integral satisfies

Math.text: absolute-value@((integral _ (formulae@(sigma = - 2 * N, absolute-value@(t) > 1)))@(F * s * differential-d@(s))) less= (integral _ (formulae@(sigma = - 2 * N, absolute-value@(t) > 1)))@(e ^ (- (pi / 2) * absolute-value@(t)) * (absolute-value@(t)) ^ (sigma - 1 / 2) * (absolute-value@(t)) ^ K * (absolute-value@(z)) ^ (- sigma) * e ^ (lambda * absolute-value@(t)) * differential-d@(s))
absolute-value@((integral _ (formulae@(sigma = - 2 * N, absolute-value@(t) > 1)))@(F * s * differential-d@(s)))

absent less= (integral _ (formulae@(sigma = - 2 * N, absolute-value@(t) > 1)))@(e ^ (- (pi / 2) * absolute-value@(t)) * (absolute-value@(t)) ^ (sigma - 1 / 2) * (absolute-value@(t)) ^ K * (absolute-value@(z)) ^ (- sigma) * e ^ (lambda * absolute-value@(t)) * differential-d@(s))

absent = (absolute-value@(z)) ^ (2 * N) * (integral _ (formulae@(sigma = - 2 * N, absolute-value@(t) > 1)))@(e ^ (- (pi / 2) * absolute-value@(t)) * (absolute-value@(t)) ^ (- 2 * N - 1 / 2) * (absolute-value@(t)) ^ K * e ^ (lambda * absolute-value@(t)) * differential-d@(t))

absent = (absolute-value@(z)) ^ (2 * N) * (integral _ (formulae@(sigma = - 2 * N, absolute-value@(t) > 1)))@(e ^ (- (pi / 2) * absolute-value@(t)) * (absolute-value@(t)) ^ (- 2 * N - 1 / 2) * (absolute-value@(t)) ^ K * e ^ (lambda * absolute-value@(t)) * differential-d@(t))
absent = ((absolute-value@(z)) ^ (2 * N) cdot O) * 1
absent = ((absolute-value@(z)) ^ (2 * N) cdot O) * 1
absent = O * (absolute-value@(z)) ^ (2 * N)
absent = O * (absolute-value@(z)) ^ (2 * N)
(1 / (2 * pi * i)) * ((integral _ (2 - i * infinity)) ^ (2 + i * infinity))@(F * s * differential-d@(s)) = R + O * (absolute-value@(z)) ^ (2 * N)

para.p:
For example, as
=
B 2
1 6
,
=
B 4
-
1 30
,
=
B 6
1 42
, the above theorem tells us that

Math.text: ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * n * e ^ (- n * z)) = (((gamma / z - logarithm@(z) / z) + 1 / 4) - z / 144 - z ^ 3 / 86400 - z ^ 5 / 7620480) + O * (absolute-value@(z)) ^ 6
